verbose_text: Our data suggest that (1) AP2 has a role in regulating CCP number, size and lifetime, as previously suggested and in agreement with recent findings that AP2 levels are finely regulated during cell differentiation with a consequent impact on CCP dynamics, and (2) one of the functions of eps15/L1 and epsin1 is to control, to a certain extent, the number of CCPs without affecting their dynamics.
